index.title: Introduction
index.description: I'm developing a small game website as a practice project, built entirely with Next.js and featuring a bilingual system powered by i18n. You're welcome to explore and play!

cards.description: Challenge your friends or the computer — get three in a row to win!
The classic food-eating game — go for the highest score!

ticTacToe.title: TicTacToe
ticTacToe.description1: 1. Board: The game is played on a 3x3 grid consisting of nine squares.
ticTacToe.description2: 2. Players and Symbols: The game is played by two players. One uses 'O' and the other uses 'X'.
ticTacToe.description3: 3. Taking Turns: Players take turns placing their symbols in empty squares. Usually, 'X' goes first.
ticTacToe.description4: 4. Winning Condition: The first player to align three of their symbols in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) wins.
ticTacToe.description5: 5. Draw: If all squares are filled and no player has aligned three in a row, the game ends in a draw.

snake.title: Snake
snake.Target1: Eat the food that appears on the screen.
snake.Target2: Make your snake as long as possible to achieve a high score.
snake.description1: 1. Control Direction: Players use the keyboard arrow keys (up, down, left, right) or tap and swipe on the screen to control the direction of the snake's head.
snake.description2: 2. Eat Food: When the snake's head eats the food, its body grows by one segment. The food then disappears and reappears in a new location.
snake.description3: 3. Avoid Collisions: Players must be careful to avoid hitting the screen's walls or running into the snake's own body.
snake.gameOver1: The game ends when the snake's head hits the screen wall.
snake.gameOver2: The game ends when the snake's head collides with its own body.
